column2: Trump: From now on the stolen election is "the big lie." Liz Cheney: No it isn't.
column5: Most of the pundit chatter about this exchange today has dwelt on how Cheney has made trouble for herself in the caucus once again by rebuking Trump. Which is true just as itâ€™s also true that sheâ€™s getting closer to being ousted from leadership. But the Cheney drama is a footnote. Whether she remains as head of the House Republican Conference is interesting mainly to political junkies not to average voters. The long-term problem for the GOP from this pair of statements comes from Trumpâ€™s statement not Cheneyâ€™s. Statement by Donald J. Trump 45th President of the United States of America: pic.twitter.com/3pZSUlq9LT â€” RSBN ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ (@RSBNetwork) May 3 2021  The 2020 presidential election was not stolen. Anyone who claims it was is spreading THE BIG LIE turning their back on the rule of law and poisoning our democratic system. â€” Liz Cheney (@Liz_Cheney) May 3 2021  Now that heâ€™s issued his edict that Bidenâ€™s victory should be described as a lie every prominent Republican in the country will be pressed on it. Including and especially would-be presidential candidates like Ron DeSantis Kristi Noem Josh Hawley and Ted Cruz. â€œDo you agree with President Trump that Bidenâ€™s victory was a big lie?â€ Theyâ€™ll try to finesse their answers by saying something noncommittal about how there were â€œserious questionsâ€ raised about â€œvoter integrityâ€ or whatever but I bet thereâ€™ll be a populist firebrand or two somewhere in the 2024 field whoâ€™ll be willing to give voters a strong-form â€œhell yes it was rigged!â€ answer. Which means the electable contenders like DeSantis will be stuck. If they donâ€™t embrace election trutherism whole hog they risk alienating hardcore MAGA voters. If they do embrace it they risk coming off like cranks to swing voters. Trumpâ€™s statement today all but forces them to choose. In fact DeSantis is destined to be asked about this even before 2024 since heâ€™s up for reelection in Florida next year. Heâ€™ll get some early practice on how to manage Trumpâ€™s demands that Republican candidates accept his alternate version of reality in lieu of actual reality. As for Cheney todayâ€™s tweet inched her even closer to the cliff: IS LIZ OUT OF A LEADERSHIP JOB? Honestly we donâ€™t know yet. But what is clear right now is that there is a coordinated effort by KEVIN MCCARTHY to box her out. The Republican leader is signaling that if anyone wants to try to force another vote to oust her from the post heâ€™s not planning to defend her anymore. McCarthy has been refusing to appear with Cheney at press conferences for months and according to our sources recently declined to give her a moderating role at the GOP retreat in Orlando even as he allowed others in leadership to head up panels. Itâ€™s also notable that one of McCarthyâ€™s new besties in Congress Republican Study Committee Chair JIM BANKS (R-Ind.) who has conference chair ambitions of his own went on record over the weekend criticizing her. â€œIf a prerequisite for leading our conference is continuing to lie to our voters then Liz is not the best fitâ€ said Anthony Gonzalez one of the 10 House Republicans who voted for impeachment in January on Friday. â€œLiz isnâ€™t going to lie to people. Liz is going to say what she believes. Sheâ€™s going to stand on principle. And if thatâ€™s going to be distracting for folks sheâ€™s not the best fit. I wish that werenâ€™t the case.â€ Darned if she didnâ€™t prove him right with her tweet this morning. In fact as I write this at 1:30 p.m. ET sheâ€™s the only House Republican to challenge Trumpâ€™s statement. Thereâ€™s no strategic benefit to her in doing so given her shaky place in leadership; she did it I assume because sheâ€™s decided sheâ€™s just not going to bend the knee no matter what it costs her professionally. An interesting wrinkle to Trumpâ€™s statement is that Facebookâ€™s oversight board is set to decide on Wednesday whether his account should be reinstated after it was suspended in January. If he cares about that and he probably should considering how it would restore his instant pipeline to tens of millions of supporters you would think heâ€™d want to keep the â€œstop the stealâ€ propaganda to a minimum at the moment. Let the board think heâ€™s learned his lesson and has moved on from denying Bidenâ€™s victory so that theyâ€™ll opt to restore his account. Then he can post what he wants and dare them to discipline him again. Instead heâ€™s gift-wrapped an excuse for them to uphold his suspension demonstrating that heâ€™ll get back to â€œrigged electionâ€ incitement as soon as heâ€™s able.
